WString String::FromUtf8ToWString (   )  const
 

Interprets the content of the object as a UTF-8 string and returns it converted to a NULL-terminated WString object. If the conversion fails for some reason the empty string is returned silently.

const CHAR* String::GetCString (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the CHAR * pointer of the content of the object. Please be aware, that this returned pointer is never equal to NULL! Even if the character string is empty, this returned pointer will point to an empty, null-terminated CHAR * string! This means that using this method and comparing it's return value to NULL for testing the String on emptiness is not correct - for checking on emptiness, the method IsEmpty() has to be used instead!

const UINT8* String::GetData (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the UINT8 * pointer of the content of the object.

INT String::GetLength (   )  const
 

Returns the current number of characters of the object, excluding terminating zero.

INT String::GetMemSize (   )  const
 

Returns the memory needed by the object. This is implementation dependent.

INT String::GetSize (   )  const
 

Returns the current number of used bytes of the object, excluding terminating zero.

INT String::IndexOf (  const CHAR *  searchstr,
INT  frompos = 0
)  const [inline]
 

Searches for the first occurrence of searchstr starting from frompos. If frompos is omitted the search starts at position zero. Either the position of the found string or -1 for not found is returned.

INT String::IndexOf (  const String &  searchstr,
INT  frompos = 0
)  const [inline]
 

Searches for the first occurrence of the String searchstr starting from frompos. If frompos is omitted the search starts at position zero. Either the position of the found string or -1 for not found is returned.

INT String::IndexOf (  CHAR  character,
INT  frompos = 0
)  const
 

Searches for the first occurrence of the character character starting from frompos. If frompos is omitted the search starts at position zero. Either the position of the found character or -1 for not found is returned.

void String::Insert (  INT  pos,
const String &  szInsert
)

Checks whether the number of characters of the object is zero.

BOOLEAN String::IsNumeric (  const CHAR *  string,
INT  number = -1
)  [static]
 

Checks if the CHAR string only contains digits '0' to '9', starting at position number.

BOOLEAN String::IsNumeric (  INT  number = -1  )  const [inline]
 

Checks if the string only contains digits '0' to '9', starting at position number.

INT String::LastIndexOf (  CHAR  character,
INT  frompos = -1
)  const
 

Returns the index within this wide character string of the last occurrence of the specified character, searching backwards starting at the specified index. If frompos is omitted the search starts at the end of the string. Either the index of the found character or -1 for not found is returned.

String::operator const CHAR * (   )  const [inline]
 

Identical to GetCString(). Returns the CHAR * pointer of the content of the object. Please be aware, that this pointer is never equal to NULL! Even if the character string is empty, this returned pointer will point to an empty, null-terminated CHAR * string! This means that using this operator and comparing it's value to NULL for testing the String on emptiness is not correct - for checking on emptiness, the method IsEmpty() has to be used instead!

BOOLEAN String::operator!= (  const String &  szcompare  )  const [inline]
 

Checks whether the object and szcompare are not identical.

String String::operator+ (  const CHAR *  pchConcat  )  const
 

Returnes the concatenation of the object and the zero terminated CHAR string pchConcat.

BOOLEAN String::PreAlloc (  UINT  nchars  )  [inline]
 

Alloc for internal buffer for at least nchars characters (excluding terminating zero character). Current WString content will be destroyed

void String::Replace (  INT  pos,
CHAR  ch
) 
 

Replaces character at position pos with ch.

BOOLEAN String::Reserve (  UINT  nchars  )  [inline]
 

Reserve internal buffer for at least nchars characters (excluding terminating zero character).

void String::Scan (  const CHAR *  format,
  ...
)  const
 

Scans the string for a series of values in the object. Syntax is equivalent to scanf. Please note: If the "vsscanf" function is available on the current plattform, an unlimited number of variable arguments may be passed. However, if the "vsscanf" function is not available (e.g. on WIN32), only up to 10 arguments can be handled at once.

BOOLEAN String::StartsWith (  const String &  other  )  const
 

Returns TRUE if the other-String matches with the start of the string.

void String::StrCopy (  const CHAR *  buffer,
INT  len
) 
 

Initializes the object by len characters of a character buffer.

String String::Substring (  INT  nStart,
INT  nLength = -1
)  const
 

Returns a substring object starting from position nStart of the length nLength. If nLength is omitted the substring contains all characters from nStart on.

void String::Swap (  String &  swapstr  ) 
 

Exchanges the content of the object and swapstr.

Converts all characters of the object into lower case characters.

Converts all characters of the object into upper case characters.

Returns the content of the object as a WString object.

va_list  args
) 
 

Accepts a pointer to an argument list. Syntax is equivalent to ANSI vprintf.
